contentrichtext.text: {{Refimprove|date=July 2009}} '''Kevin Robert Elz''', often referred to in computing circles as '''Robert Elz''', or simply '''kre''', is a [[programmer|computer programmer]] and a pioneer in connecting [[Australia]] to the [[Internet]], and more recently, in connecting [[Thailand]]. ==Career== Some of his achievements include developing a number of important Internet [[Request for Comments|RFC]] documents, helping connect Australia to the world-wide Internet, developing the internet-based research network within Australia, and operating the [[.au]] domain registry from 1986 through to the late 1990s.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.rogerclarke.com/II/OzI04.html|title=The Internet in Australia}} by Roger Clarke</ref> He also managed the <tt>aus.*</tt> [[Usenet]] hierarchy from its inception in the 1980s until the mid-1990s. He is an Honorary [[Fellow]] at the [[University of Melbourne]],<ref>{{cite web|url=http://newsroom.melbourne.edu/studio/ep-31|title=It started with a ping|publisher=University of Melbourne Newsroom|accessdate=19 December 2011}}</ref> where for some years he worked in the [[Computer Science]] department. Having previously lived and worked in [[Melbourne]] for many years, he currently lives in [[Hat Yai]], [[Songkhla Province|Songkhla]], Thailand,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://old.coe.psu.ac.th/en/staff_detail.php?staff=17|title=Elz's staff listing at Thailand's Centre for Network Research}}</ref> where he is an honorary lecturer in the Computer Engineering Department of the [[Prince of Songkla University]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://old.coe.psu.ac.th/en/|title=Department of Computer Engineering at the Prince of Songkla University}}</ref> ==Operation of .au== As the architect of the early domain-name eligibility criteria for ".com.au", Elz is largely responsible for Australia's not experiencing a domain name gold rush in the mid-1990s. The eligibility policy required a direct connection between a company's official name and its domain name, in contrast to the strictly first-come-first-served policy of the [[.com]] registry. Elz was, however, criticised during his tenure, as domain name applications often took many months to be examined{{Citation needed|date=February 2007}}, despite the commercialisation of the Internet and customer demands for quick turnaround times{{Citation needed|date=February 2007}}. He was also responsible for the controversial handing-over of the operation of ".com.au" to [[Melbourne IT]] in 1996.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.caslon.com.au/audaprofile2.htm|title=auDA and dot-au: History|accessdate=19 December 2011}}</ref> ==References== {{reflist}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Elz, Kevin Robert | ALTERNATIVE NAMES =kre | SHORT DESCRIPTION =Australian computer scientist | DATE OF BIRTH = | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Elz, Kevin Robert}} [[Category:Australian engineers]] [[Category:Australian expatriates in Thailand]] [[Category:Computer scientists from Melbourne]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Year of birth missing (living people)]] [[Category:University of Melbourne alumni]] [[Category:University of Melbourne faculty]]
